One of the best games I've played with friends.  So many things have been stated time and time again by other people, about how awesome the perk system is, or the combat, or even the maps and community.  But all that aside, there is one thing that really sets KF apart from the rest of the pack:  It is FUN to lose.  Not as in 'do it all the time' but when you do lose with friends because you all get mowed down by a pack of fleshpounds, you cant help but laugh.  A LAN party must for anyone who likes holding the line.

Killing Floor is a game that I pick up every now and then, and always end up wondering, "Why don't I play this more often?" The weapons are very satisfying to use, and every enemy in the game can be a reasonable threat. The final boss is among the most lethal of that I have ever seen (despite the fact that there are ways of easily beating him), as he is: faster than you, has an instant-kill rocket launcher attack, a minigun that has a chance of killing you in a burst (about a second), and melee attacks that brutalize you/send you flying away. This game is especially fun with friends, and the 7 (pretty sure it's 7) classes are all useful in some respect. I highly recommend picking up this game at sometime, especially if it goes on sale.

Lots of fun if played with friends. Common rabble might be a little too occupied trying to help themselves than trying to keep tabs on one another. A bit of a grind to level up. Free maps and seasonal specials from the devs. All in all: great game.
Really fun game, if you enjoy challenging shooters.  Very fast paced.  I recommend waiting to try it on one of its many "free weekends", and maybe buy it while it's discounted on one.

This is one of the better games that I have bought on Steam in a very long time.  I bought it during the 2013 Summer Sale, didn't play it until December, and I was really missing out.  Killing Floor has tons of maps and fan-made servers, not to mention plenty of customizability with Workshop.  The Bullet Time ZEDTime really works with the way Teamplay has created this game, and with the new Christmas additions, it's a game no one should miss out on.

Killing Floor is my new favorite horde-based game, that's what you do KF, mow down legions of zombies with your team(under most circumstances). If that concept appeals to you then the rest should even more, there are a variety of enemies to keep you aware from the simple clot to the irritating Sirens as well as the Flesh Pounds. The multiple classes(which are levelable by the way) give you many different approaches to combat zombies, I find the demolition class to be particularily up to my speed. Explosives+zombies= a fun combination. The adjustable difficulty levels add a lot to Killing Floor's replay value, even if you've just started, the beginning difficulty proved entertaining and easygoing as I learned the basic ins and outs of the game.I recommend this game for anyone who's seeking a fun co-op experience and likes killing zombies.

Killing Floor is great at what it does. It aims to be a Left 4 Dead style Co-Op shooter and is arguably better. There's a large range of guns, maps and enimies to encounter and there are still many servers online 4 years after release. It's perhaps the most fun you can have with friends playing Co-Op.

I don't even know why I haven't reviewed this game yet, despite having (Probably) spent more time in it than any other game in my library. Really, what else is there to say than, it's fun! Not just the game is good but so it it's community, in most cases. 

I recalled plenty of moments where after a wave I was short on cash, only to feel a smile tugging at my lips when a random person ran up to me and started throwing dosh at my face while yelling the game's characteristic “Loadsa moneh!”  

There's beginner mode which is easy and can help any starting player learn the ropes, getting their first perk levels while chopping off specimen heads left and right, is there's one thing bad about it, is that from beginner to normal is such a huge jump, making the game suddenly feel rather, difficult for new players. It does however do well at making the players work together. Two people working as a team can wreak havoc in hard mode whereas six people that don't will only end up failing in normal. I like that.

Every match can last anywhere from 3 minutes (If you die early) to 45 minutes (On long games) and whether you win or not, you'll still most often know that you made some progress levelling towards your next perk level.

It will probably go on sale again this winter, and the monsters will all look their christmassy best again (They already do!) so if you have a bit of dosh. Get it, bring some friends, and get hunting!

Killing Floor is a Co-op survival horror game that is played in a first person view. The game is really simular to games like left 4 dead and counter strike although not as much variety. the game has two game modes that you can play with friends , the killing floor mode that is basicly like surviving until the last wave of enemies. And the objective mode that makes you go and do tasks for different people in order to survive. The game has long and intense gun fights that are always fun to play and challenge yourself with different kinds of weapons. the game is very big but has little change of gameplay its basicly run , shoot , buy , and boss fight although even if the gameplay is not that original or different its still a lot of fun to play.

The game is very challenging and is a lot like Payday 2 in the fact that you pretty much need some people to help you out in the missions or else its almost impossible to make it. All in all its a great mindless shoot them up to play with friends and having a badass soundtrack while killing all kinds of monsters standing in your way go take a look and have fun.

If you love to kill zombies, you'll find this game quite amusing.  Very awesome game, I enjoy it a lot.

Simply put, if you enjoy First Person Shooters, Survival Games, Co-op, or horror, you will LOVE Killing Floor.

This game sports a variety of weapons, each designed for a "Class". When you start a match, you can choose a Perk, making you suited for a role (ex. Medic, Support Specialist, and Commando), you can change the perk at any time though, and you level up the perks gradually, helping you face harder difficulties (which you can select at any time). As a team, or alone, you face waves of genetically modified clones, that each have unique traits (for example, one type can cloak, another can walk on walls and leap far distances). At the end wave, you fight a "Boss" of sorts, that has a rocket launcher on its shoulder, and a chaingun for an arm. Yeah, it can be as hard as it sounds. 

That's how a standard match goes, but as of late, objective based maps have also been introduced, and the Developers make special events for holidays and seasons, and also update things just for the sake of supporting the game, and adding new stuff. You can also shake things up a bit with mods, which you can easily get on the Steam Workshop. Mods include maps (which can have objectives or special things like acid floors, for instance), weapons, character models, and even unique gamemodes, like one that is directly based on the Aliens franchise. 

Overall, I would say that it is a very addicting game with extensive support from the developers and the community. It is also fairly cheap, and honestly, it is not much of a risky buy, because it is honestly just so addicting (coming from a FPS lover).

The gameplay doesnt offer something like cod zombies, or L4D, but this gameplay is challenging with a BUNCH of different maps, and random amount of zombie spawns, The game is quite challenging.  The Zombie boss, is probably one of the hardest "Bosses" I've faced in a zombie game (as long as your on any difficulty above normal) The graphics are great, the game is fun, and the music is... well lets just say amusing at best :P. I would definitely buy this game while its 50% off!

У вас есть оружие,на карте есть зомби.Вы убиваете зомби и покупаете новое оружие.Звучит скучно,не правда ли?А вот и нет!
В игре есть разные типы зомби против которых есть свои стратегии.Для убийства некоторых "ходячих экспериментов" нужна слаженная работа всей команды.Также присутствуют 5 перков,которые разнообразят тактику защиты/нападения.
Пара слов о dlc. Dlc паки обычно содержат скины и рескины и только несколько паков нового оружия,поэтому советую купить bundle pack и не тратить деньги на оставшиеся dlc.Всё нужное уже включено в bundle pack.
Еще нельзя не отметить саундтрек+стоны зомби.Получается неплохая композиция,хоть трек записывай).А если у вас есть несколько друзей ,то покупайте игру ,берите еду ,запускайте скайп/РК/стимовский голосовой чат и погружайтесь в кровавое (хоть и не очень графонистое,но это НЕВАЖНО),захватывающие и смертельно опасное путешествие по зараженной Великобритании.
